mdRecord.dcterms:title: Sons of Rest Pavillion, exterior

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Name taken after a poetical name for senior citizens. This pavilion, to which MacAdam referred, is the park's largest, one of several designed by Eugene L. Greenleaf. The name now attached to the bold gold, brown, cream, red, and blue "summer house" arose from the popularity of the shelter and its surroundings among St. Louis's seniors as a shady spot for reading and relaxing, a tradition that continues here and in the air-conditioned Stupp Center nearby. -- http://www.towergrovepark.org/index.php/history/pavilions.html [work]
